page.title: 16CLOTHING IN HOPTON
page.content: People in the Hopton area are far less fashion conscious than city dwellers and they tend to wear clothes for many years rather than buying new ones every year. Many people here buy their clothes from mail order catalogues rather than travelling to the towns and cities. In 1985 a ladies casual summer outfit could be a cotton blouse with a skirt or dress to just below the knee and gathered waist with grey or brown tights. A man might wear cotton or denim straight-legged trousers, a short sleeved tee-shirt and a pair of light training shoes. Winter styles are very similar to summer ones, however the clothes would be made from wool or warm man-made fibres eg. acrylan, with long-sleeved jumpers. In very cold weather people wear scarves, gloves and hats with their coats outside.
